I could not of picked a better night to do hiking yoga. It was purely amazing to enjoy the hills surrounding coit tower around sunset time.
Eric is energetic and makes sure you get a great work out in by hiking the hills and creating for 4 stations to do some yoga. 

It is an amazing concept to blend the yoga and urban hiking! What I liked about it is that you get to see unique views of the city, socialize, work out and feel amazing afterwards. What more can you ask for? Sign up people!
author: Rachna P.

description:
I went to the Berkeley hiking yoga class.  It was an eye-opening experience!  After having graduated from and lived in Berkeley for 20 years, this was the first time I walked up and down those stairs up in the Berkeley Hills.

Lots of uphill hiking, sprinkled with bits of yoga in scenic places, very nicely done.  The instructor is a dancer.  Maybe next time she could teach us how to dance, too!

I appreciate being able to take BART to the meeting place.

Will try SF next!
author: Debbie C.

description: My friends and I did the San Fran hike.  This is a great workout.  We didn't know what to expect and we were pleased with the challenges.  Just when you think you can't make it up another hill, there's a little yoga time.  The views were incredible and well worth the trek.  Julie was our very energetic leader and she kept us moving.  Like others said, the meeting spot was easy, it was well organized and our leader was great.  Excellent start to the weekend.
author: Robin R.

description:
Hiking yoga was my first new workout of 2010 and I was pleasantly surprised. I really built up a sweat and my cardio was challenged. Our leader Eric was upbeat and motivating and when someone asked how he was feeling in the beginning of class and he answered "great" I knew he was charged up.

The urban hiking took us through many SF neighborhoods that I have not been on foot and I've been living in the area for over 15 years. I appreciated the 15-minute sessions of yoga which were disbursed during the 90-minute workout.

There were about 8 in our group that morning and it was good to meet new and interesting people, especially the 2 women who had just moved to the area within the week.

I will return to another session with Eric soon.

P.S. Breakfast after our workout with the group was fantastic!
author: Cecile R.

description: WOW! I was attending the Yoga Journal Conference and this was the last class I had on Saturday. The day was so beautiful and what a great way to end my day! It was VERY rigorous, but it was by far the best class of my day. Greg, our guide was so, much fun and enthusiastic! I can think of NO better way to see the city, get in a little yoga and DEFINITELY get an amazing workout....you will most certainly see me again!!
author: Barbara H.

description:
Holy moly!  I'm in love.

If you're anything like me, you love to be active but quickly get bored with the same ol' same ol' workout routine.  Well what better way to battle the bulge (and the boredom) by being active on the streets of our fair city, all while doing interval workouts, taking in gorgeous views, and learning a little bit of local history?  If that last sentence wasn't too long for you, read on!  

Things you need to know:
1)  You should be a basically active person, because you'll be treking around at a brisk pace.  We're talking SF hills here people -- it's not called "hiking" for nothing!
2)  You really only need to know some basic yoga.  Eric, the instructor, will correct your form and help you out as you go.  He'll ask some questions about your general workout routine to assess what you want to work on. 
3)  Class size will vary -- mine ended up being a wonderfully personal session as only my friend and I signed up that day!  You have to RSVP via phone or email for a session, even if you're planning on dropping in that day.  
4)  You don't need to schlep a backpack or water bottle -- Eric makes sure to stop at various water fountains along the way.
5)  Even if you know back alleys galore, Eric will most likely lead you to some hidden gem you've never seen before in the City.  

I'm talking up this business to everyone I know.  Go -- go now.  Your body will thank you.
author: Deidre B.

description: Great exercise and a lot of fun. Instructors are personable and motivating. I did the Woodside hike and just signed up for the SF one in a couple weeks. If you're like me and you need some motivation to get out and exercise and you want something to challenge you, then this is the perfect work out for you!
author: Shira O.

description: This was my first time hiking through the Berkeley Hills and adding yoga into the mix was fantastic. Christiane, the instructor was great! She kept a vigorous pace throughout and incorporated 4 stages of yoga in stops that were visually inspiring. I experienced a great workout and it was super fun and invigorating. I can't wait to go again!
author: Julie G.

description:
Hiking Yoga was a great experience in many ways - the views, the conversation, and the workout! 

I was drawn to the idea because it seemed like such a unique experience and I wasn't disappointed. Our group ended up being small so there was a lot of time for Erik to correct our postures while doing the yoga - which is great for someone who doesn't get to a studio often (Read: ever). 

Also, he's a wealth of knowledge of San Francisco and definitely brought us places in Telegraph Hill/Russian Hill area that I had never seen, even though I lived in that part of town for 6 months! We saw some stunning views and nothing beats meditating at the top of Coit Tower 

The hiking is definitely a workout, so be prepared to get in gear and walk quickly up some pretty intense hills. The yoga is definitely do able for beginners, so don't be intimidated by that! 

Overall, this is such a great value and a good social experience. I went with a friend on Sunday and it was great to do something different rather than just grabbing coffee. I'm excited to try a Saturday hike where the end is the delicious Farmers' Market!
author: Liz S.

description: I'm reviewing Wesleigh's Sunday morning class. So much fun, great workout through the city on a sunny day! I've signed up for a drop in session 2x before and every time the instructors have been excellent. I told my friends about it and they both signed up and enjoyed the class.
author: Theresa A.

description: This is a first for me. Either i do yoga OR hiking- on separate occasions when one has recovered from the other. But this is really cool to combine both activities in one. It was a  nice workout, not strenuous. I would definitely try this again- on a nicer sunny day though!
author: Melanie S.

description: Fun weekend activity to get out of the house. First time doing yoga after several years of declining to try it. Good for introductory yoga with some light to moderate hiking in the concrete jungle.
author: Cody B.

description:
This is a great workout!  It is a great balance between cardio, stretch, sight-seeing, socializing, and over-all well being.  The structure of the session alternates between cardio and yoga, and ends with a lovely little meditation at Coit Tower.  It is a very intelligent program.
My endorphins were still going the next day.  Also as a person in moderately good shape I was easily able to keep up with the pace. 
The instructor Christiane Crawford was excellent too.  I will definitely be doing this workout again.
author: anna K.

description:
This was a wonderful way to spend an evening! I found hiking yoga through groupon and decided to give it a try. I practice yoga with a few different teachers in the city, but also enjoy my cardio workouts. I thought, what an interesting way to incorporate both!  Our guide GReg was amazing;  he's sweet and makes the hike very engaging and fun. The yoga tidbits in between were gentle and informative if one is new to yoga. While Greg made the hike look easy, this can be a bit of a workout, which is great.

Also, the people on the hike make the experience very fun and engaging.  You laugh, you get your heart rate up, you climb some steep stairs and you get to connect with new people. The partner stretching poses at the end were fun and playful! I would definitely do this again. Thanks Greg for a fun adventure.
author: Jodet G.

description:
I went on the Saturday 10:30am hike in SF with Emily as our guide/instructor.
It was a beautiful day!
I will do this again for sure, so fun!
author: T B.

description:
Vibrant Saturday morning in SF.. what better to start the day with?
A fantastic hike thru SF's hidden gardens (and even a stop at for Diego Rivera's foreshadowing mural of the gg bridge construct 3 yrs later..). Intervals of asana are thrown in every 15 minutes or so to break it up and you cover quite a distance from downtown-northbeach-china town-nob hill! We saw fantastic bloomin' flowers, epic views of Mt Tam, both bridges, and the Bay while mingling w/ fit people at a fast clip up SF's famous hills. Eric is full of info; historical, literary, and also had unique ideas on the yoga too.. always fun for the seasoned practitioner.  And best yet-- it pours you out hungry and well-sweat at the Ferry Bldg farmers mkt on Sat morn. A hearty thumbs up!
author: Rachel S.

description: Great idea to combine my three favorite loves:  hiking + yoga + SF.  I went on their complimentary first class - which consists of fast-paced urban walking, with a bit of yoga thrown in between and after at picturesque stops with a view.   Like instructor Eric's energy in motivating us up those hills, Megan's yoga in between our two stops, and a rediscovery of the charms of the city.   Our particular walk up Vallejo Stairway, Greenwich Stairs? to Coit Tower, down the Filbert Steps, was a good workout - I was mildly sore in my calves after. Eric says the route changes, but I'm not sure how often I would want to do it, perhaps every so often.  But, I definitely recommend the Saturday morning classes so you can be rewarded with the ferry building farmer's market after and in general for out-of-towners/SF newbies to get a fun view of the feel and vibe of our beautiful city.
author: Peg S.

description: The SF hiking yoga Kicked my Ass! Beautiful and Amazing urban hike through out the city. We started at the Ferry building and ended at Coit Tower. An extra bonus was it was on a Saturday so the ferry building farmer's market was going on and is such a treat! You will not be dissapointed!
author: Rachel A.

description:
So good!

I've never (ever!) done Yoga before.  I don't know what Pilates are, really.  Growing up as a "husky" kid, I had to force myself to love exercise so I wouldn't end up looking like Alec Baldwin circa "30 Rock".  I want to look like Alec Baldwin circa "Hunt for the Red October".  

Anywho, I usually stick to running and biking to keep the gut in check.  My girlfriend had pushed Yoga for a while, but I wasn't too interested in  cramping myself in a tiny room and listening to Yanni or whatever goes on in most Yoga studios.  This is why Hiking Yoga was such a treat!

Instead of being cooped up, you strut the streets of San Francisco at a brisk pace!  Bonus points for a runner.  Then you get down to stretching with some of the best views of the city (some I hadn't seen before even after 5 years of living here).  

Eric is a great teacher and good to talk to as well.  He is really on to something good here and I hope more people break out of the studio and go exploring and stretching in the streets.
author: Jacob M.

description: Took my boyfriend to Eric's class in San Francisco today. The hike was very interesting and discovered new things about my neighborhood, and the yoga was also wonderful. What a great way to start the Sunday morning!
author: Jenny Z.

description: Today we did the Los Gatos hike with Eric and loved it.  This course is open with beautiful vistas throughout.  Really enjoyed Eric's instruction.
author: Kate C.

description: I went on the SF hike on Sunday morning with Wesleigh and I can't think of a more perfect way to spend a morning! Wesleigh is very upbeat, warm and friendly. I loved getting to see the city in a new way with so many fantastic views and secret little trails. I felt such a sense of gratitude that I get to live in this beautiful area. If you do it, you won't regret it!! I can't wait to do it again!
author: Laurel S.

description:
I had the opportunity and pleasure of trying hiking yoga last weekend and was pleasantly surprised at how vigorous and exhilarating an experience I had.  The 75-90 minutes just flew by and the group got to see some spectacular views of San Francisco on a glorious Bay Area Saturday morning.  This workout is a must for yoga enthusiasts because it takes the experience from the stuffy, staid studio outside while providing a natural stimulus of fresh air scent from the local gardens, green grass and bay breeze.  This is not a cake walk; you will get a significant cardio push while pausing intermittently for some yoga exercises in between. 

Eric, our leader and instructor is perfect for this sort of thing.  He knows the nuances of the city, especially those hilly streets and stairwells surrounding the North Beach neighborhoods.  He's not type A, but a great motivator and just a good guy who enjoys the experience.  Megan, not as experienced, but was equally adept leading the group with some stretching exercises and yoga positions.  Kudos to both.

I highly endorse this concept as a welcome change to the standard studio yoga class and look forward to future experiences.
author: John S.

description:
What a fun morning!  I took my 4 kids, age 10 - 20, on a yoga hike with Emily.  How tough could it be?!!  Well, it was a wonderful workout as we trekked, at a faster pace than I expected,  up the hill at Wunderlich Park in Woodside with intermittent stops to stretch and gaze up to the blue sky peeking through the redwoods.   

A fabulous day hiking and enjoying nature, new friends, and family.  Many thanks to Emily.  I would recommend this outing highly and we'll try the SF/Ferry building one in the future.  Can't wait to take out of town guests to experience this too!
author: Kathleen W.

description:
I was looking for yoga studios near my office & google led me to Hiking Yoga.  Instructor takes small groups on urban hikes thru SF & you stop & do yoga in various gardens along the way.   It was AWESOME!   It's not possible to recommend too highly.  We need more than 5 stars.   

Brilliant idea - pairing 2 of my favorite workouts.   It's up there w the idea to combine peanut butter w chocolate, but much healthier.   

Nice to workout outside.  And hike was fast paced / up hills so it felt like I was getting in a great workout.  Eric is a fantastic instructor!    Loved doing yoga in beautiful gardens in SF!  Definitely increases the post-yoga aaaaaah! feeling.   

My only regret is not discovering them sooner.
author: Whit L.

description: Wesleigh led our class from the Ferry Building.  She guided us to some beautiful places and routes that I had never seen before - and that's saying a lot considering I'm an SF native!  The experience was  great: yoga poses mixed in with beautiful views, a good hike, and getting to meet other SF yoga peeps.  I highly recommend Wesleigh as your hiking yoga guide!
author: Ron I.

description:
Hiking Yoga is an awesome way to explore San Francisco while getting in a great workout.  Eric took us to beautiful parks, hidden stairways, and other secret spots around the City.  Lots of amazing views too.  During the session you'll get in a rigorous walk with some yoga breaks along the way.    

I highly recommend taking your out of town guests on a Hiking Yoga adventure...they'll be impressed!
author: Anne Z.

description: This was a fun activity to experience. Not super rigorous when I went this weekend, and the yoga portion seemed very beginner level, plus it had to be done while still wearing sneakers (since it's outside, and they don't bring full-size mats), but the instructor was very friendly and likeable, and it was refreshing. I went on one of the hikes through Berkeley, and it was cool to see some new spots and find some hidden stairways I didn't realize were public. It was also nice to do yoga in an environment that feels clean and fresh rather than hot, sweaty and cramped like a lot of more traditional yoga studios in the Bay Area. It'd be nice if they could have different hikes geared toward different ability levels, or incorporate more instruction on variations based on ability level for the yoga postures.
author: Jamie T.

description: Fantastic morning with Christiane as our guide and yoga teacher. The weather was perfect and the views were to die for. Christiane lead our group with energy, passion and really engaged with the participants. I thoroughly enjoyed the morning. Only complaint was that it was over too quickly!
author: Danielle M.

description: Great hike in SF!  Covered a little over 3 miles starting at the Embarcadero and ending at Coit Tower...with LOTS of hills in between.  Definitely got my heart rate up since we were walking at a pretty fast pace for most of the time.  The short breaks consisted of stretching, holding yoga poses, and a lot of breathing. Excited to sign up for another one soon!
author: Janelle F.

description: Loved this! Beautiful views but also a great workout. Vigorous walking the entire time with a few tougher hills and flights of stairs that will get your heart pumping. We stopped for 3-4, relaxing yoga poses for about 5 -10 minutes each in such peaceful, beautiful areas of the city...took some pictures of the amazing view after each stop. Christiane was very sweet and lead the hike very well. She's a great yoga instructor and made it such a peaceful experience. I definitely recommend this if you're visiting San Francisco like I was, or even if you're from the area as long as you're feeling up to the workout!
author: Tara H.

description: Took the Berkeley hike with Christiane and it was great.  The path we took was beautiful and it was more strenuous than expected.  I am more of a hiker than a yogi, but was able to get a lot out of it.  Planning on doing the SF hike in the near future.
author: Sherril R.

description: A super awesome experience! You just have to make sure to allow yourself enough time to find parking and then to join the group at the "mystery" location on campus. Christiane is so much fun and she really motivates you to get through to the end! I wish there was a little more yoga to it, but its a good work-out all around and  you get to enjoy beautiful Bay Area scenery that you may not otherwise know of.
author: Araceli E.

description: I've done a few of the hiking yoga classes.  They are all very different and a great workout and a fantastic alternative to the gym.  The one in Woodside is in Wunderlick park, which is very serene in the trees and on the trails.  The one in Berkeley explores some fantastic neighborhoods and parks that you would never see normally.  Be aware that the Berkeley hike is VERY strenuous with lots of hills and stairs.
author: Kim W.

description: A lot of people seem to really love this company, but if you're already used to a high level of cardio, don't expect an intense workout from this.  I did the Los Gatos yoga hike with Lisa, and while the website says it's an hour and a half, that's apparently only to the top of the hill--then another half hour down for me, and I was walking by far the fastest of anyone in the group.  Like a couple other reviews have mentioned, this is mostly hike and a tiny bit yoga, which was disappointing for me, because as an avid hiker, I was hoping to get a bit more of an introduction to yoga.  Also like another review said, the "yoga" was mostly stretching, and I felt like I'd rather have just gone on a hike with yoga at the end or something.  This may not be a problem for most people, since it seems that most of the introductions to this service happen through people who are into yoga, but if you're like me and used to lots of fast-paced cardio, don't expect a workout--or much yoga--with these hikes!
author: Liz L.

description: Did this in Los Gatos today.  It was a great workout and an amazing view.  Eric was a great leader!  I love the combo of cardio and yoga.  Fantastic!
author: Tori P.

description: Had my first hiking yoga experience on Sunday and am just smitten with the experience.  First big surprise was how those San Francisco city hills nearly knocked the wind out of me!  I LOVED the challenge of working my moneymaker to get up hills through beautiful and quaint neighborhoods that I didn't even know existed.  I also appreciated how perfectly timed the yoga reprieves were between the more challenging climbs.  For a novice hiker like myself, this made the whole experience more enjoyable.  I thought I would be painfully sore the next day, but instead my body felt alive and well!   Highly recommend the SF hikes to newbies and anyone on the fence about hiking or yoga!
author: Crystal M.

description: OK so yeah... Ive done yoga. Lots of yoga.  Been here, been there, been almost everywhere.  Until I had been here I thought I had seen or done most all forms of yoga. Thank YOU Greg for showing me that not all yoga is the same.  Thank YOU Greg for getting me outside with my practice, in front of buildings, in parks, on steps, in places that I had never thought to do yoga before. We went at a perfect pace, burned some calories, saw sights, met new people, and BEST of all had FUN! Isnt that what Yoga is about. AWESOME!
author: Joe S.

description: Hiking Yoga is a great idea and for those who like to see hidden areas of the City, this is just the thing for you. After reading some reviews, I finally decided to use my Groupon and get out there. I went on a Sunday and Christine was our guide. I am not in shape so I kept looking in astonishment while Christine looked to be strolling while I felt like I was doing a fast walk/semi-jog. These hills and stairs are no joke. Everytime I saw one from a distance, I wanted to turn around and get lost. Unfortunately my bf was with me so I couldn't sneak away. But once I got to the top, the views made it all worth it!!! After the hike, I felt like my day could really start and I enjoyed it after all the work.  Definitely worth a try!!
author: Cynthia F.

description: I love telling people about hiking yoga!  It's such a great experience and unique idea.  I've been to 3 different bay area hikes within the last year. Woodside, Los Gatos, and Berkeley. All the instructors were professional and knowledgeable. All hikes provide great views and a great workout!  Eric, who is the owner, leads some hikes. He's funny and motivating and showed us some great new yoga moves.  Not just standard warrior and triangle poses.  I recommend getting there a little early b/c parking is always a little scarce and bring water and layers. You start out cold and end up hot.  Also, its great to bring a friend or meet new ones.
author: J S.

description: Took a fantastic Hiking Yoga session in the Berkley Hills this past Saturday. Being a 20 year Bay Area resident, it was wonderful and refreshing to take a new and unusual hike and get to a lovely panoramic view that I have never seen before. My skill level is that I am an intermediate yogi and a novice hiker. It was a comfortable yet challenging hike- the stations for asanas came just at the right time for me. And the coolest part about Hiking Yoga is that it is a really fun and social, but still allows room for moments of thoughtfulness and inner reflection in the hike and practice. I highly recommend a Hiking Yoga experience to everyone I know, and I look forward to checking out more throughout the Bay Area locations, and when I travel.
author: Jen S.

description: I went on my first hiking yoga outing last weekend in Los Gatos.  I really enjoyed the combination of activities - although I would have enjoyed more yoga.  It was beautiful day and the group leader Eric was fantastic!  I will definitely be out there again soon!
author: Mike K.

description: Did the Hiking Yoga in Berkeley - very impressed!  I was a yoga "virgin," but no stranger to hiking (it definitely helps to be in some semblance of good shape to do the hills).  Christiane was great, giving individual feedback during our yoga stops.  While it's true it is more hiking than yoga, as another yelper mentioned, it is, after all, HIKING yoga, not the other way around.  I'd say if you like hiking, and you're okay not doing every yoga pose ever devised (we did get a deeper stretch in at the end of the hike), you'll love it.  Go HY!
author: James W.

description: Hiking Yoga with the founder Eric was without question, the best workout I have had in a LONG time! It was strenuous, it was fun, I was out of breath as I hiked up and down so many different sets of steps. I stretched in ways that I have not before and I am feeling it today. It was amazing. Yes, you hike a lot! And when you stop for yoga you really delve deep into different postures. I recommend this to anyone who is looking for a way to spruce up their regular routine. AMAZING. I can't wait to do it again! :)
author: Michaela D.

description: This is one of the most awsome things i`ve done in a LONG time..  I love Hiking yoga..  I`ll be back!!!!  Thank you for such a great time..
author: Jack O.

description:
Went on my first hike (Groupon) last weekend  - Los Gatos.  Elena, our instructor, was a gem...delightful energy, inclusive, hiking back and forth and up and down to make sure she kept good tabs on her group.  It was a lovely combo of hiking and stopping to take in the beauty, yoga, making new friends.  A great, great time...better than I'd expected.

I think the owner, Eric, could be a little warmer in his communications - his emails tend to be short and..well, just short.  There's no extra extension of  'customer service' felt.  

So, as I'm rating the company as a whole,+4 for the hiking/yoga experience,  -1 for customer service behind the scenes.
author: Jennifer M.

description: I did this yoga hike twice, once with my 20 something daughter and once with a friend. Awesome both times! Love the hiking/yoga/outdoor experience, yoga not too intense but you still really felt stretched out. The hike can be at whatever intensity you want to make it. Great opportunity to explore unique areas in KC while multitasking. I have lived in the area for over 12 years and have not visited some of the areas this took me too and I was very excited to see them. I will be back! Thank you to Eric Kipp, the instructor, he did a wonderful job making everyone feel welcome and capable, no matter what skill level you brought.
author: Heather C.

description:
My friend and I took the first 2 classes through Groupon and another class as walk-in. The first class we attended was one in Log Gatos with Elena. We enjoyed hiking in the mountain, but Yoga was minimal. The second class we attended was one in SF with Greg. We REALLY enjoyed his class; his Yoga teaching skill was awesome! He pushed us hard to walk faster and faster going up and down the hills in SF, and it was great cardio exercise. The most recent class we took was one in SF with Megan. Compared to Greg, Megan seemed not very enthusiastic and motivated about teaching the class, and we didn't enjoy her class as much.

Overall, we enjoyed Hiking Yoga especially with Greg. We would definitely take his class again, but not with other instructors.
author: Satoko S.

description:
Very Fun and Very Difficult. Sore for days.

Eric, our leader, was awesome. He is informative, conversational, and motivational.

This is good for people of all levels. I myself am a yoga beginner and I looked like the TinMan out there but Eric helped and assisted me and over all great experience.
author: Kenny V.

description:
I did the Wunderlich Park version of Hiking Yoga with the company founder, Eric Kipp, at the helm and it was fabulous.  I am newer to yoga and was surrounded by a lot of people who clearly have spent a bit of time in yoga studios.  Eric did a great job of meeting each person where they were at and making subtle adjustments to help each of us get to our edge without pushing too far.  The timing of stopping at the yoga "stations" between hiking was just right.  He knows just what he's doing with alternating cardio with stretching as well as using lateral moves from yoga to counteract all the back-and-forth movement of hiking.

Eric was very personable and made it a point to talk with each of us and answered all kinds of questions about yoga and hiking and overall fitness.  His knowledge, athleticism and interest in others makes him a natural at this biz.  I will definitely be rejoining him on the trail soon.
author: Veronica R.

description: An enthusiastic 5 stars.  The Woodside location is beautiful, the instructors (Eric and Ryanne) are awesome, and the workout is great!
author: Lynne C.

description: Hiking yoga is a lot of fun, the instructors are great and SF is an amazing place to do hiking yoga. One of the funnest things you can do to get a work out and see the city!
author: Andrew S.

description:
WOW I'm in workout love with this combo of some of my favorite things - being outdoors, hiking, exploring new parts of the city, and learning yoga! 

My sister and I discovered this gem via group on - and I am so glad we did! Eric took us on a great hike all over downtown, Chinatown, Russian Hill, and Nob Hill, stopping at hidden parks with beautiful views for some yoga at the right times (like when my out of shape body was telling me it needed a break). We both liked how personable and encouraging Eric was without being pushy/overly peppy, and he told us awesome tidbits about the City as we hiked. Best part was Eric was able to bridge the gap between the yoga experts and beginners by walking us through poses and having us build up to the final, more intense yoga workout at the end. It was a perfect blend of cardio, stretching, and strengthening my core... I don't think you should be intimidated if you haven't done yoga before or aren't in tip top shape - many people weren't, myself included. 

I'm hooked and can't wait to do it again!
author: Meredith C.

description:
Had a fantastic experience with Hiking Yoga class in Berkeley yesterday on a sunny Saturday morning.  On the evening before I had requested a last minute sign up to add my partner on the hike and received an immediate response by email that even though the class was full at that point, they would add him in so he could join me. We felt very grateful and welcomed by that gesture. It made all the difference in our weekend plans. Thank you!
The hike and yoga were divine in the hills of Berkeley and our instructor Emily had a gentle, encouraging and powerful presence. We met some great people that we got to know as we bonded over climbing the hills and reaching an incredible view of the bay. 
What a great way to start a Saturday morning! Highly recommend it!
author: M. H.

description:
Did hiking yoga this Saturday. The urban hiking was really pretty, Eric takes you on beautiful stairways, the gardens are gorgeous, you almost forget how hard you're working on the uphill parts. 

We stopped in 3 spots to do yoga, and each location has spectacular views of the city and bay. I like yoga, but I'm not a yoga nut, but doing yoga outside with these views was really lovely.

The hike I did was Saturday morning from the ferry building during farmer's market, so I shopped for fresh produce after. Sometimes I just love San Francisco!
author: Gabrielle C.

description:
Hiking yoga is awesome! I tried it for the first time last Sunday with Megan's group and had a great workout and a great time.  It is no easy hike, so first-timers-be prepared to feel the burn!  While the hikes were challenging, the alternating pace of hiking then breaks for yoga was just my speed and kept me going. 
You can't beat ending the hike with a yoga session on the grass at Coit Tower with the wild parrots flying around above you against the gorgeous backdrop that is our city! I highly recommend Hiking Yoga as a fun way to get a great workout and enjoy the city.
author: Kim C.

description: We were Yoga Newbies when we decided to try this hiking an yoga thing.  Greg met us promptly at the Ferry Building at the Embarcadero with his enthusiasm and energy. We started off at a brisk pace and the adventure began!  As we headed up, up, up the hill, we stopped periodically to do yoga at the most beautiful vantage points in the City!!!  We ended up in the Grace Cathedrial court yard with the chimes ringing to do couples yoga!!!  This was so much fun and an excellent way to see parts of the city that we have never explored!!!   A must do when visiting or if you have time to play in San Francisco,
author: Kim H.

description: Greg was great!  He took us all over the city to places we've never been before.  He got our heart rates up and then brought us back down with some calming yoga.  Just what we needed after a long week!
author: Gordon B.

description: I recommend trying a yoga hike. It is great for even complete beginners to yoga. You need to have some cardio endurance because the walk is brisk and about an hour with many breaks. The entire hike is about 90 minutes. It is just a great way to see the City and areas you'd never imagine going. We saw the most gorgeous city views. A great couples thing to do, too. Try something different, and you will be pleasantly surprised. Our instructor was Eka, and we really enjoyed him. Learned so much about breathing and different energy flows. He taught us about healing injuries of various sorts from carpal tunnel to bad knees along with how to live as an urban yogi. Two thumbs up!
author: Lisa M.

description: What an excellent workout, and not to mention a great way to explore the city. Eric knows all the neat spots to hit up.  As a newbie to SF, I've got to see many parts of the city that I would have never found on my own.
author: Ames L.

description: What a wonderful way to spent a Saturday morning! Greg's class was great - we got a serious workout climbing Telegraph hill and hiking through the Financial District and North Beach. Greg said the class would be focused on bringing greater awareness to our breath and after panting as I hiked up many flights of stairs, I was amazed at how Greg's yoga instruction helped me so quickly regain my breath and center myself. I'd love to take this class again!
author: Kate C.

description:
I will definitely do this again.

Had a great workout.  Strenuous (read heart rate above 180) at enough points and for long enough but not too long that I stopped before the next easier part.

Our teacher Greg was great and made sure everyone was taken care of that that our individual goals for the day were being met.

Loved walking around parts of the city I haven't seen.
author: Nicole K.

description: Greg was so great! First time doing hiking yoga and I loved it. Greg was great about moving at a fast past to keep our heart rates up as well as stopping to take a breath and find our balance through some yoga poses. I can't wait to try another route in the city with him!
author: Caitlin C.

description:
I love hiking.  I like yoga.  This is both.  And it was awesome.

Our instructor Greg met us at the ferry building, and was personable and friendly.  He told us a little bit about himself, what we were doing, and we were off!  (Note, there's a lot of traffic on Saturdays at the ferry building, and there's no real meeting "spot", so just clump together with the other people wearing workout clothes standing around looking clueless)

Greg made sure to keep everyone together (I think we had a group of 15 or 16) but wasn't a nazi about it.  We walked a little bit, and then had our first yoga pit stop for about 5 minutes.  Then we hiked to the top of two high points in the city (which had amazing views) and stopped for about 10 minutes of yoga at each point.  We hiked down to a grassy spot close (enough) to the Ferry building and did some sitting poses on small mats and some partner stretching.  

All in all, I enjoyed the experience, Greg was an enjoyable instructor and I would definitely (and can't wait to) go again.  The hiking is urban (you're in the city, duh) so if you're looking for more outdoorsy, try Los Gatos or possibly Berkeley?
author: L. J.

description: Hiking Yoga is awesome. I have done the Berkeley yoga hike and loved it. Christiane was our lead and she is great. She helps with form and keeps the group together. It is a quick paced hike and a great workout. Good combination of uphills, stairs and very nice spots to do the yoga sessions.
author: Erika M.

description: As an avid hiker and yogi I was super pleased to get such a challenging workout. So many great views and fun people! We even had the Parrots of Telegraph Hill chattering about 6 feet away from one of the spots we stopped for yoga.
author: Jaime R.

description:
I will definitely do this again:

1. FUN way to EXPLORE the CITY
2. GREAT low-impact WORKOUT
3. GREG is an AWESOME leader
author: Julie M.

description: Had a great time this morning at the south bay location at Lexington in Los Gatos. Elaina was a wonderful coach and guide. This is such a great idea to be in nature and combining hiking and yoga. We really enjoyed ourselves, and the wonderful views. I was up late the night before and was dreading this, but it was a big boost. Can't wait to give Woodside a try and am glad you've added the south bay locations!
author: Lisa W.

description:
great comprehensive work out. 

parts are challenging - we charged up 3 big hills. eric said you burn anywhere between 800 to over 1000 calories per session. 

we made 4 stops and did stretching and yoga. i loved doing familiar yoga poses while outside and surrounded by beautiful views of sf. 

this is a unique experience.
author: Yevi A.

description: What a beautiful way to start your weekend - first time I went, it was miraculously fog/cloud-free.  Great hike started at the Ferry Building and Eric took us on a tour (after giving us options) through the Vallejo Street gardens and then we ended up at Grace Cathedral.  This is really for all levels - you can make it harder or easier.  I like to run stairs and do yoga a couple times a week, so I thought this was a perfect mix.  If you're a beginner to yoga, don't be afraid - most people in my group were - and it wasn't a big deal.  If you're intense about yoga - this isn't the hardest yoga you've done, but again, it's a fusion of hiking/yoga, and anyway, you can make it harder if you want.  Ended back at the Farmer's Market - and did a little shopping - before trotting on home.  Perfect (and productive) way to start a Saturday!
author: Peggy Y.

description:
Christianne led us up and down hills at a quick pace, did some yoga and stretched out.  We had a great workout, saw places in the city that I never would have gone to.

This is a great thing to do with friends or out of town visitors.

Highly recommended.
author: Heidi P.

description: After weeks of debating how to ring in my 30th birthday I stumbled upon Hiking Yoga. I called up Eric and he was super enthusiastic about leading a private group and assured me that we would have a great time. He did not disappoint. Fifteen of us met him in Woodside for a beautiful hour and a half hike interspersed with yoga breaks every 20 minutes or so. The workout felt awesome, there was lots of time to chat and catch up with each other and we all left thinking what a great way to start the weekend. We hit up Alana's Cafe in Redwood city afterward for brunch and all in all had a fabulous birthday celebration. Eric is a great teacher, good at leading a group and his enthusiasm sets a fun tone for the day. I would highly recommend Hiking Yoga for a group event. It's different, healthy and a really fun way to get outdoors.
author: Jamileh C.

description: This was my second hiking yoga day. I will have to say being a San Franciscian, I enjoyed the serene Woodside hike better.....the trees, being away from the Urban life was a true treat. Emily was a wonderful guide- energetic, fun, nice and kept up with all levels of the group. I was choose the next hike with her for sure.
author: Freida O.

description: A great way to get a solid workout in- this class kicked my ass (and apparently burned over 900 calories). The cardio portion was difficult for me (others didn't seem to mind it so much, and others lagged behind me at some points- skill levels were all across the board), but I'm glad I did it. The hike took us to great views of the city, and with each pause we received individual attention with our yoga poses. Our instructor, Greg, was very friendly, very much in shape, and did a great job pushing us forward and tweaking our postures. It was challenging for me at multiple points, but by the end I was loving it.
author: Leslie N.

description: Went on my first hiking yoga led by Kristin at Balboa Park, SD. The weather was perfect, the hiking was moderate yet enjoyable, and what could be better than doing yoga under clear skies on the warm earth. Kristin was upbeat and fun. The hiking and yoga followed a nice progression and she kept a calming feeling throught the session. It was great! I'll definitely be back for more!
author: Jacqui H.

description: Wow what a wonderful idea! I was visiting S.F. just for the weekend and went to a Saturday Morning class, which I think was the nicest day San Fran has ever had. It was so fun and Energizing. Eric was a great teacher and it was a great start to a wonderful weekend. I will recomend it to everyone I know.
author: clare p.

description: What an amazing way to end a day. Me and a couple friends met Eric at the Ferry Building at 5:30 , not only did we discover so many secret areas of SF we had a great workout and much needed relaxing yoga sessions. Eric is such a great person, he made the whole thing so much fun and he is extremely knowledgeable about this city and fitness. I CANNOT wait to do it again!
author: Laura Gardner S.

description:
Hiking Yoga with Eric was awesome.

We took the women from our office as a bit of a bonding experience. In 90 minutes we did a 4 mile walk with 3 10 minute stops for yoga. The stops were all situated amongst amazing views. Eric did a great job of tailoring the yoga to the group on the fly. The bonus was ending up back at the Ferry building for the farmer's market.

Eric is also a historical tour guide so he really knows the city and and can tell you all about the places where you are walking as you pass by.

Hiking Yoga is great for locals, team building or showing around fit visitors.
author: Sarah G.

description:
This was an all around awesome experience. The alleys and gardens he took us through were beautiful and I never knew any of them existed. The hiking was at a quick pace but Eric was very patient while my friend and I dragged ourselves uphill at the back of the group. The yoga was a perfect complement to the rigorous hiking. 

I give both Eric & hiking yoga 5 stars. I will definitely recommend this to my friends (and go with them). 

Note: if you can, leave bags at home. It must have been the extra weight that kept me at the back of the group, not the fact that I'm out of shape...
author: Amy W.

description: This is the best workout around-- with spectacular views, gorgeous scenery, and a great combination of zen and heart pumping.  In the past month, I've enjoyed the Woodside and SF routes (each with wonderful instructors named Emily), and they were both invigorating and super fun!  The pace is fast but the routes are brilliantly mapped, taking you to fabulous spots you might not otherwise find.  In Woodside, we did tree pose atop tree trunks in the woods, and did a wonderful assisted dancer post in a circle.  In SF, we did warrior pose looking out over the Bay Bridge to Treasure Island. What a treat this was-- hope to rally some girlfriends to join me next time!
author: N S.

description:
loved the class.  erik is a great leader.  the hr and half zipped by w/o notice.

thanks E
author: Marcia B.

description:
Wow...Great new way to explore SF and get an awesome workout all at the same time.  I had an old friend in town who was new to SF and signed us up for Hiking Yoga as a way to share the city.  

I was not disappointed...walking straight uphill (fast!) and stopping in pocket-park gems along the way for yoga intervals exceeded expectations on all fronts.  Our route (http://bit.ly/dlOB07) was well-planned for views and cardio challenges....& sunset yoga at Coit Tower was inspiring.  

Eric is energetic and very personable - an expert at keeping groups together and energized around history, fun, and exploration.  I can't wait to join another hike soon.
author: kathy s.

description: We just did hiking yoga over the weekend with Greg Molkentin in the city and it was fantastic.  It was a very challenging class, yet, filled with the gorgeous scenery of the city and of course beautiful practice of yoga at each stop station.  This was our second hiking yoga and I personally liked Greg's class much better than my first class which was in the east bay.  Somehow, the way his class worked, I got the right workout but do not feel extremely sore the next day.  I can not wait to take his class again.
author: Nagina A.

description: I used Hiking Yoga for a corporate group event -- Chelsea led our group on a great evening hike through San Francisco.  Everyone enjoyed themselves and had a great time!  It's a really fun event to do with a group from work and I got a lot of positive feedback from everyone. Recommended!
author: Aimee K.

description: This is a really fun way to meet new people and see some pretty parts of the city but I would hardly call it yoga. I think I probably exercise more than the average person but I think this would not have been a workout for a person in moderately good shape. Overall it was a fun experience but not good yoga and not a good workout and prob not worth $20.
author: Sarah R.

description: I had a great time hiking and doing yoga with Eric.  He gives great instruction and takes care to make sure that everyone in the groups that he is leading is attended to.  Its definitely a vigorous exercise, so be prepared to move, at the same time, I also felt that it was about testing your limit, not overextending.  Great views of the city were incorporated into the hike along with knowledge of history of the areas we went through, I saw places and pathways through the city that I did not know existed, even after living in the city for years.  Great experience, I highly reccomend it.
author: Eric R.

description: I can't imagine a more inventive, challenging  and FUN Sunday morning with better views of San Francisco, new tidbits about my city and great company and a great sweat!  Do yourself a huge favor and check this out!
author: Beth W.

description: Christiane was a wonderful guide/teacher/mentor. The hike was an excellent one through Berkeley Hills and the yoga interludes were well spaced and very well done. a lot of this has to do with the personality of the leader and Christiane certainly has it.
author: craig m.

description: Wow! What a great way to spend a morning in SF.  I was in the City with my wife for a short weekend trip from LA.  After a gluttonous weekend of eating and drinking, it was nice to cap off the weekend with a yoga hike. Eric knows his stuff: 1) the city/hiking, and 2) yoga. Eric will show you some awesome parts of SF.  I think even a local would learn more than a few things while on the Yoga Hike.  We  definitely plan on doing another trip with Eric next time we are in San Francisco.
author: Alfredo G.

description: I love hiking yoga with Julie Bennett! I go every Saturday at 10am and it is a great way to start the weekend. The groups are 15-20 people and most people are very friendly and social, which is nice because you can provide moral support to each other while climbing those hills and stairs! It's about 45 minutes of hiking around the city and climbing hills/stairs, and 45 minutes of yoga, itnterspersed between hills. At the end of the hike you feel refreshed and energized. HIghly recommended!
author: Tina A.

description:
I tried the hiking yoga this morning with some work people. Eric offers a great morning workout with hiking and yoga intermixed throughout the beautiful views of San Francisco. 

He is very knowledgeable not only about yoga but also the history of many landmarks in SF. It was a great way to start of the morning and would definitely recommend it to anyone wanting a great outdoor workout. 

His morning classes are perfect for before work and ending at the Ferry Building is a great place to grab breakfast before heading to the office. He also offers an evening class for people who don't enjoy the early mornings.
author: Veronica A.

description: I have been on Yoga Hikes in both the Penninsula and San Francisco.  They are different and both are fantastic!  It is a great cardio hiking workout, with stops in between to appreciate the surroundings and do some yoga poses.  It offers a great interval training program.  The hike with Wesleigh in the city took us down the most amazing hidden streets, gardens, and paths I would have never known about on my own.  What a great way to explore your own city, or to share it with out of town visitors. This class far exceeded our already high expectations,  You gotta do this!
author: Edie G.

description: I'm a huge fan of the SF class. I've been several times with a number of different instructors. Greg keeps a brisk pace and the yoga is a little more challenging - definitely my favorite. I also enjoyed classes with Eric, Jennifer and Megan. This is an awesome way to get up and out on a weekend morning. It's always fun to chat with others, and the flowers, views and secret staircases are beautiful.
author: Joanne S.

description: I joined the hiking/yoga trip this past weekend, and it was awesome.  I'm a local and Eric and Megan took us to places I've never seen, beautiful gardens and high-up places with great views.  The yoga was a great way to break up the hike inbetween destinations.  Eric and Megan were extremely friendly and encouraging and everyone in the class enjoyed the experience.  Do yourself and your body a favor and sign up for one of the classes today.
author: Jennifer C.

description: This was so much fun, I went for the first time last sunday as I had a groupon coupon. We all met outside the Ferry Building and there was about 12 of us in total. It was definately a workout, with walking all the stairs and up and down hills. There were three yoga stops with the last one being at Coit Tower. I would highly recommend it , I am new to SF and this was a perfect opportunity to see more of the city and to meet new people.
author: Nina K.

description: A perfect balance of cardio and grounding yoga while enjoying fabulous views and cutting through new (to me) stairways and streets of the city.  I left feeling great.  I recommend it!
author: kristina a.

description: A GREAT way to spend the day, it far exceeded our expectations. Greg was our instructor and he did a phenomenal job, so thanks to Hiking Yoga and Greg we will be back!
author: joe k.

description: Hiking Yoga is best way to start your Sunday morning! The route I've done twice now, through North Beach, up top Russian Hill and ending at Coit Tower is beautiful and gets your heart rate up and your blood flowing.  Stopping along the way to do standing yoga poses (no mats are used during the hike) is the perfect way to enjoy the views of our beautiful city.  Wesleigh is wonderful!  She's super friendly, approachable and an excellent yoga instructor.  I appreciated that the yoga wasn't too intense since climbing those hills and staircases is intense enough.  Ending at Coit Tower is the perfect culmination.  My one request would be to have longer yoga sessions throughout the hike, even if that means less hiking, but that's just me.  I highly recommend Hiking Yoga in San Francisco! oh and grab brunch afterwards - you deserve it :)
author: Celina D.

description: A sweet experience and not what I expected at all.  I thought there would be a hike, and then yoga.  Instead, you get a little yoga snippet at a number of different idyllic spots that they've carved out of the neighborhood.  A great way to see parts of the city that you've never been to! Overall, a 4 - 5 star experience from an exercise standpoint - nice cardio and nice stretching.
author: Rebecca P.

description:
Excellent work out.

Beautiful scenic route.

Knowledgeable, cool, instructor.

Highly recommended.
author: Jeff F.

description: Hiking Yoga is a great work out!  There are different levels of hiking so explore some different days with Eric.  He is a supportive and friendly guide - he will share some tidbits about the city if you can keep up with him!  Lizzie is a great, positive energy to have on the trip too.  She's spirited and motivating the whole time.  It's not necessarily for slow, peaceful sight-seeing - instead you'll flex and stretch your body and you will feel energized the rest of the day!  I recommend doing earlier in the morning, so there's no traffic (exhaust).  Bring cash for the farmer's market afterward - a delicious way to end a hike.
author: Anna I.

description: Hiking yoga is a great combination of hiking in a group yet at your own pace (I trailed way behind most of the group but that was all fine), and yoga exercises good for dummies like me as well as for more flexible / experienced people. I had a great time on the trail, felt fantastic the rest of the day, and I'm already signed up for next week!
author: Meike S.

description: Hiking Yoga was something I found online, and when I suggested it to some friends I rec'd an overwhelming response.  We were not disappointed; Nicole was a great, energetic and knowledgeable guide.  Along with leading our hike, she pointed out great spots for picturesque city views, as well as showing some of us natives hidden spots we didn't even know about.  She also made some really fun photo ops for all of us as a group.  The hills in SF make a great workout, and the yoga was relaxed, fun and good for all fitness levels.  I will definitely be doing this again, and have lots of friends who can't wait to join up!
author: Niki N.

description: I enjoyed Hiking Yoga with Eric very much. Wunderlich Park is beautiful and I will definitely plan another trip!
author: Diane G.

description: We found this via a promotion on Groupon.com and we loved it.  We had the San Francisco hike/yoga class and it turned out to be quite a work out.  Greg Molkentin was our instructor. He seems to be very knowledgeable on the yoga poses as he explains the benefits to each pose thoroughly. The route chosen provided beautiful scenic views and pace can be as challenging as you want it to be.  All in all, highly recommended. I can see that it is well worth the money even without the groupon.
author: Tony L.

description: I've done both the SF and the Berkeley hikes with Christiane.  She is fantastic.  Both were great opportunities to get to know the city and find cute, out-of-the-way niches to relax/picnic/do yoga/etc. We ended at Grace Cathedral on our SF hike, which was a great place to end and do the longest yoga session, as it seems so spiritual given our location.  It was great to hit some of the hidden pedestrian paths in Berkeley on our East Bay Hike.  Both were nice workouts on lovely days with interesting people and good conversation.  A perfect way to start the day, whether going with friends you know, or making new friends along the way. I definitely hope to do this again!
author: Susan L.

description: This is an AWESOME class! Since it's mainly hiking over yoga, it's a great way to get in your cardio. You hike up hills to bring your heart rate up and stop to catch your breath and stretch with yoga. You can't underestimate how much better it is to do yoga outside! It is a great balance of the two. It lasts about an hour and a half. The people who come to the class are really fun and cool to talk to along the way. That is, if you can talk while sprinting up hills...  Even though the class kicked my butt (we burned over 900 calories), I am really looking forward to the next one. I have never felt so great after working so hard. Greg was our instructor and he was uber flexy/bendy, walked up the hills like a trained sherpa and  was so friendly - he really made the day!
author: Linda M.

description: Just did this today at Woodside, Ca with Ryanne, great time, and great experience, to be with nature !!
author: Sunil J.

description: Loved this class!  I've been meaning to start yoga for ages, but just haven't been able to get myself to go sit inside in a studio.  Hiking yoga is perfect for me - I love hiking and get to be outdoors while I'm learning yoga. I got to work up quite a sweat on the hills, balanced with the stretching and balance of the yoga.  Greg is a great teacher - very enthusiastic, positive and encouraging.
author: Elan K.

description: 6 of my girlfriends and I pick a place and meet there every year. We always have good intentions of "working out" but this year we made it part of our "sightseeing" time and it turned out beautifully. Greg was our former monk, ready to push you, and then calm you down leader. We got our heart rate pumping, we saw the sights, we took pictures, we found our inner peace and stretched our little pinkies... Instead of aimlessly wandering, or hoping to find Coit Tower and some of the best sights the city has to offer, Greg got us there! He was wonderful, we found a little inner peace, got some wonderful pictures and finally... a workout that didn't waste our precious time together :)
author: A S.

description: Definitely recommend trying this out and getting out and seeing our beautiful city. Went on sunny day and had so much fun hiking up the hills and doing yoga stretches along the way. Greg was our instructor and he was great. Everyone I dealt with from the front desk to the instructors have been king, friendly, and eager to help.
author: Jacquie D.

description: HIGHLY RECOMMENDED. I think all these 5 star reviews prove how amazing this class is. Class is $20 for a drop-in, you can buy a few sessions at once for a discount. I did the Sunday morning hike and I just wish I had discovered this sooner. The group of around 10 people takes off from the Ferry Building and goes all over the city. We went all the way over to Russian Hill, of course hiking up many stairs and huge hills. It's set-up so that you don't have to be in amazing shape to enjoy this, but this is also not for someone that never exercises. Christine, went fast enough to keep the advance people engaged, but not too fast that the rest of the group couldn't keep up. We stopped at 3 different spots along the way to do some light yoga and stretching. Gorgeous views all throughout the hike. Dress in layers. You WILL be sweating. I would probably bring a water bottle, because there might not be a drinking fountain til the end. For sure, the most I've accomplished before noon. LOVE IT! :)
author: Kate C.

description: Great Concept to combine Hiking with Yoga!  Great way to see the city, new areas while exercising.  We get to 'hike' throughout the city, up and down hills and then stop in several places and do yoga.  Felt very refreshed afterwards and calm.  Greg is an ama zing instructor.  Strongly recommend taking the class!
author: Smriti S.

description: This isn't really about San Francisco.  We formed a group for a birthday celebration to have Eric, of Hiking Yoga, treat us to a session in our home turf of Santa Cruz, CA.  Without ever having been to DeLaveaga Park, Eric scouted the area, communicated professionally and flexibly with me, got the weather to cooperate, and led a fantastic experience of hiking and yoga.  We all especially loved the partner work.  Eric creatively dealt with muddy trails by coming up with lots of standing yoga poses and by using mats on top of picnic tables.
author: Allison C.

description: Had a great time on the hike.  Did the hike through Berkeley with Christiane.  Beautiful hike and challenging yoga.  I'll be back.
author: Mary R.

description: I made the mistake of taking the Berkeley Hiking Yoga with Christiane. After everyone checked in she told us we would be going at a fast pace and stopping at the Rose Garden. My friend and I got stopped at a traffic light and saw Christiane almost running up the street never once looking back. It felt like she was on her own hike! We yelled after her since we got caught at a red light. By the time we were able to cross she was way up the hill and when we got up there we couldn't find anyone. We asked someone for directions to the Rose Garden and when we got there the group wasn't there! We ended up staying at the Rose Garden a while and then left down hill. What a disappointment! When I got home there was an email saying that we should take cardio training beforehand! She was totally rude and we never got to experience hiking yoga. I heard SF is much better, but after that experience, I'm not rushing over there. I'd recommend go on your own hike and take a yoga class. There wasn't any interaction with the other people, and Christiane clearly was doing her own thing and didn't care about the group.
author: Marjorie W.

description: The hikes are challenging and tons of fun- Eric is a great teacher and tour guide.  My favorite aspect of the hike is discovering new things about The City- hidden alleyways and vista points, walking through neighborhoods you usually don't walk through is great, helps give you a whole different perspective on San Francisco.
author: Oleg Z.

description: Had my first hiking Yoga experience on Sunday in Berkeley with Sarah. It was AMAZING! We started off immediately with a nice brisk walk and before I knew it we were going up hills and passageways I never knew existed. the 1.5 hours flew by even though it was raining. It was such a unique way to see the city and get my exercise too. Can't wait to try it in San Francisco too.
author: Ellis K.

description: Wow! What can I say? It seems like most Yelpers have already captured the glory that is hiking/yoga. Eric is just great.  He even helped us chose where to dine after class to get back some (or all) of those 1,000 calories!!
author: Nicole B.

description:
This is my first Yelp review but Hiking Yoga with Eric has been such a GREAT experience that I would feel guilty if I didn't share it with the Yelp community. I would (and have) recommended hiking yoga to any friend or co-worker, whether new to the city or a long time resident, who loves the city and enjoys a good workout. I have been yoga-hiking five times now, and thanks to the instructor Eric's endless knowledge of off the beaten path trails and spots around the city, it has been a new and exciting experience every time. Hiking yoga is a rare, uniquely San Francisco work-out that combines the beauty of San Francisco's urban environment with the fun and challenge of both yoga and hiking. I would describe hiking yoga as having three equally-awesome components (with the first two being implied in the name):
1) Hiking yoga includes hiking at a good pace up and down the hills of San Francisco, moving through the FiDi, Chinatown, North Beach, Knob Hill and Russian Hill. Eric is flexible as to the number and location of the hills, so if you have something particular you want to explore or challenge yourself with let him know. However, the hiking component is definitely intended to get your heart rate up and burn off those garlic fries so you should show up expecting a cardio workout. 
2) The second component is yoga. Each hike includes three different yoga stations, which are usually flat spots with incredible views. The yoga is used to break up the challenge of the hiking, so yoga usually occurs every twenty minutes or so after some strenuous uphill. I was pretty much new to yoga and felt somewhat lukewarm about it before hiking yoga, but standing scenic spots around the city, I really enjoyed yoga for the first time. Eric has a lot of experience teaching yoga, so he also helped me to feel comfortable and pick up yoga technique quickly.
3) The last component is kind of a sight-seeing/city tour aspect because the instructor is also a city guide and knows tons of information, historical and present, about the city. Since I am new to the city, Eric worked in everything from Grace Cathedral to Café Trieste. He also seems to know a lot of cool spots and facts that even long-time SFers on the hike were not aware of.
Groups range in size (usu. 2-5) and the price is totally affordable (currently $15 for 1.5 hours and $10 your first time). 
Hiking yoga embodies everything that is great about SF and I will miss it dearly when I move away!!! Appreciate what you have here and check it out!
author: Aurora S.

description:
it was my lucky day- i got a private - bittersweet...in the end - i had a awesome work out -went on a beautiful hike...a perfect evening.
hike+yoga= brilliant! thanks eric
author: mary r.

description: This was a vigorous fast paced workout and especially fun on a beautiful day.  Eric and Megan were good leaders with lots of knowledge of the City.  I loved how they took us through parks and scenic areas of the City I was unfamiliar with.  It was quite a workout with a fast hoof up the stairs to Coit Tower and beautiful cool down stretch with yoga poses at the top and meandered through hilly and shady spots through North Beach and Nob Hill.  It's a fantastic way to spend your Saturday morning with the Ferry Building Farmers Market at the end.  I would highly recommend it and do it again!
author: Ruby B.

description: Hiking Yoga will make you happy.  Eric is great and knows about fabulous stairways and nooks...It kicks your butt so it's not good for couch potatoes...though I did hear him say that he adjusts the level according to how the group is doing...two of us were huffing and puffing at the back but we caught up at the yoga stops.  Loved it.
author: Julie G.

description: Eric leads a yoga class every Tues night at 6:30 at the Mill Valley Health Club. Eric's class is wonderful, combining strength training with restorative postures in a combination that is well-suited to his attendees. His up-beat attitude makes the class fun and he sets a good example for this students.
author: Roney W.
